intro: Timonius xanthocarpus, commonly known as the yellow-fruited timonius, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive yellow fruits that mature in the dry season. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture, while its stems are often woody and branched. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
